results.title: The Wild Duck
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Phillip Emanuel and Film Bancor of Aust
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Henrik Ibsen about the fortunes of a loving family - the ineffectual loving father whose pride and dreams conceal a life of poverty and failure, his practical wife and their beautiful and faithful young daughter. The family is broken apart when deceived by the misplaced idealism of another person. Stars Liv Ullman and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: Dogs in Space
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: Young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, Glenys Rowe, Burrowes Film Group and Entertainment Media
results.description: A group of young people enjoy the summer of 1979 in the belief that they will never grow up and join the adult world. Action centres on a Melbourne household of punks, hippies, students and radicals who represent the counter culture and the punk generation living on sex, drugs, rock ‘n’ roll and television. Stars Michael Hutchence of INXS.

results.title: Norman Loves Rose
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Basil Appleby, Direct Hit Productions and Norman Films
results.brief_description: Norman is a sensitive, precocious 13 year old preparing for his formal entry into Jewish manhood, the bar mitzvah. He is also passionately in love with his sister-in-law, Rose, who is pregnant. Stars Carol Kane, Tony Owen with Barry Otto, Sandy Gore and Warren Mitchell.

results.title: Asya's Happiness
results.brief_description: Asya Klyashina is a cook in a small Russian village, lame and unmarried. During harvest time she works at a field camp where she renews acquaintance with Sasha, a driver returned from the city, who announces that he loves her but has no thought of marriage. Mothers look after their children amid the harvest; the men reminisce about the Patriotic War (“fighting for the Motherland, for Stalin”) and about the prison camps after the war. But complications to her life start when Asya discovers she is pregnant by another youth, Stephan.

results.title: The Sixth part of the world
results.brief_description: Dziga Vertov was the founder of the Soviet documentary. He headed a group of experimental documentarists who took the name Kinoki, or Kino- Eyes. As a militant theorist he proclaimed the supremacy of what would now be called Cinema-Verite. His films and his theoretical writings have had an enormous and lasting influence on world cinema. “The sixth part of the World” is Vertov’s lyrical cinema poem to the vast expanses of the Soviet Union, grand, complicated, exotic and hugely popular.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure that will delight the whole family. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island” and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.

results.title: The Night the Prowler
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Anthony Buckley, Chariot Films and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This story begins as a comedy surrounding the reactions of the Bannisters to an alleged attack on their daughter, Felicity. From this point on, Felicity embarks on an odyssey of self-discovery. Adapted by Nobel prize-winning author, Patrick White, from his own short story. Stars John Derum, Maggie Kirkpatrick and Terry Camilleri.

results.title: Merry Christmas Mr Lawrence
results.creator_credit: Nagisa Oshima, Jeremy Thomas and Recorded Picture Company
results.brief_description: Set in a Japanese prisoner-of-war camp towards the end of World War II, the story subtly explores the bonds that develop between men in stressful situations; bonds that often transcend culture and inexplicably, sometimes, even transcend the barriers between captor and captive. Based on a novel by Sir Laurens Van Der Post. Stars David Bowie, Tom Conti, Jack Thompson and Ryuichi Sakamoto Takeshi.

results.title: Georgia
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Bob Weis and Jethro Films
results.brief_description: Judy Davis stars as Nina Bailey, an investigative lawyer on the threshold of a dynamic career. Everything is going in her favour it seems, until she moves into an exclusive seaside apartment. The tranquil view from the apartment becomes a window onto her past; a past that threatens to be her executioner; a past full of secrets concealed from her all her life; secrets about Georgia, a woman she has never known. Also stars John Bach and Julia Blake.

results.title: The Umbrella Woman
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Jan Sharp, Laughing Kookaburra Productions and Michael Nolin
results.brief_description: An innocent passion for a forbidden experience leads Daisy (Rachel Ward) into a three-sided relationship with her forgiving husband (Bryan Brown) and her husband’s brother. When small town prejudice threatens to overturn all their lives Daisy’s sexual pursuit becomes even more of an obsession as she turns her attention to the newly arrived womanising barman (Sam Neill) - with almost tragic consequences.
